title: Harness uses generic 'timeout_or_killed' when observer exits — no way to distinguish manual close from crash
description:
When the user manually closes the observer window, the harness injects a timeout_or_killed game_over event identical to what it writes for a server timeout or process crash. The game summary prints 'Game did not finish (killed or disconnected)' with no indication the user intentionally stopped it.

Meanwhile the headless client processes keep running — in game_20260210_090609, the match continued for ~18 minutes after the observer was closed, wasting API credits.

Evidence:
- game_events.jsonl:436: {"type":"game_over","reason":"timeout_or_killed","message":"Game ended (no GAME_OVER received)"}
- server.log:72: Second game started at 09:33:46, ~15 min after observer closed
- Pilot error logs show continued activity until ~09:37
- harness.py:954-960: observer_proc.wait() then _ensure_game_over_event() with no exit code inspection

Fix: Check observer process exit code (0 = window closed, non-zero = crash) and use specific reasons in the synthetic event. Update summary messages accordingly.
